#summary The document.removeChild method
#labels about-dom,is-dom-method

== Arguments ==
child, pointer to the element poised for removal.

== Usage ==

oldobj=parent.removeChild(child)

In which:

 * oldobj is a reference to the deleted child.
 * parent is a reference to the parent object of the object to be removed.
 * child is a reference to the removed object.

== Tips ==
You can use the reference to the deleted object to re-insert the object underneath a new parent or even to temporarily remove the object from the DOM and reinsert it later.
